page.title: 03SOCIAL LIFE IN GODMERSHAM
page.content: Many families participate in village events, creating a sense of community. Many activities are centered in the village hall which was built with money raised by the residents. There is an active Sunday School and a small regular church congregation which keeps the church clean and beautifully decorated with flowers. More attend Christian festivals and care about the fabric of the historic building. The village provides little work, no school, shop, post office, doctor or public house. Most families possess a car and travel to nearby towns for these services, and also the theatre, cinema and sports facilities. Most families have made a positive choice to live in the quiet of the countryside and are content with the shortcomings of the life.
